pullRequest.bodyText:
Many thanks for submitting your Pull Request ❤️!
Description: this PR adds a toolbar to the task inbox page. The toolbar consists of filters which can be used to filter out the user task instances.
JIRA: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2092

nodes.bodyText: white space formatting (missing space after if).

I would rename the id argument into something more general, as in both cases below, the value is not an id really, it's either state or taskName ... so I would rename id->value or similar.
That might also apply to the type argument ... it's rather a categoryName passed to the ToolbarFilter component, right? Also in case of this attribute and checking strings below, I'd like to see a more tighter relation, not just string comparison - can we have an enum Category with values Status and TaskName for example? those values would be passed as categoryName to ToolbarFilter and then matched here below (possibly by a switch instead of two independent ifs).
can't we filter the options based on the status string rather than relying on fixed offset?

We need to mock the TaskInboxToolbar in all but this test to prevent the huge snapshot file.
Easiest way might be:

move this test to a separate file.
in TaskInbox.test.tsx mock the TaskInboxToolbar component.
in the new file don't mock it (for exactly this test).
